item.title: data visualization using a bar chart
item.description: library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggiraph) library(ggplot2) df<-Teams%>% filter(yearID==1980)%>% select(name,HR)%>% arrange(HR) df\(name<-factor(df\)name,levels=df$name) ggplot()+ geom_bar(data=df,aes(x=name, y=HR),stat=“identity”, color=“blue”, fill=“white”)+ coord_flip()

item.title: data visualization using a histogram
item.description: Let us say we wanted to graph the weight of all baseball players to ever play. A nice display of this information could be in a histogram. First, we need to install the necessary packages and call them in using “library()”. library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggiraph) library(ggplot2) Next, we can use our select function to select the players’s weights, in the “Master” table. We can also make sure that we exclude any players that we do not have data available for.
